text: *commercials*
Ladies and gentlemen, welcome! Let’s begin with the main thing. We are in a Lamborghini.
That’s the Urus. It is the first crossover which Lamborghini ever made.
This is a rental car, and its rent costs some big money even per day!
And I was like: "What bullshit, no one cares about that car; nobody would rent it.
But okay, I will take it. Let's make a video about Urus.
And they said that I had only one day to rent it because there’s a two-week waiting list.
I also was on that list to make a video, and 14 more people are ready to pay a crazy price
for driving it during one day only. WHAT?
Why is it so attractive? How does that car work?
Why are people willing to give such crazy money for renting and buying it? It costs $300000!
And why I’m on fire already??? I’ve just got my ass on that seat!
Lamborghini-f*cking-Urus, today, is on the test!
Holy shit! 3,7! 3,7!
Going deeper through this enchanting spectacle, because of which you’ve already gone crazy,
you recognize the mode in which the car would murder you.
It's because even when you are getting ready to make the launch,
and you know that it will be fastened in a moment, the one completely exceeds your expectations.
But then you're going out, and you're watching it and saying: "Wait for a second! That's the blank switch!”
There’s no adaptive cruise control!
Then you are looking at your windshield, and you see that there's no head-up display!
So what exactly I got when I paid $300k for that?
Okay, I have an air suspension and some other shit, but still, there's no soft closing door!
These handles too. This is Lambo, but look! They're usual.
They don’t flush with the body of the car, they’re not popping out,
and they’re not hidden or somehow complicated as we got used to.
Is it Volkswagen here?
And when we open the hood, we see "Made in Germany” everywhere.
I didn’t know that Germany has that flag. I was thinking that…
Well, probably someone has already invaded the country and our slogan “We can do it again” someone already did…
So, that’s all kind of weird. And you’re starting to get the hang of this.
And you begin to understand that your money was paid not for the things you supposed to.
And this price was made by taking one thing, then adding second thing
and here you have a hybrid of two things: Lamborghini and Volkswagen.
And what exactly is left here from Lambo? Of course, this is the interior.
It’s the unusual gearbox control
because we know that it was always uncommon in Lambo, and there was a semi-automatic transmission.
Here everything is a bit weird, for example, when I need to reverse the gear, I have to do that thing, I have to do that thing,
and when I want to move forward again, I have to pull the right shift paddle to turn the 1st gear on.
It will even run if I release the brake.
There's Also “M button” and start-stop button, of course, under the red flip cover, as it’s done in aviation style.
On the left, there's a drive mode selector, and it's making unpleasant clicking.
Not cool. And on the right, there's another selector which is for configurable drive mode.
It's called EGO. These are settings which you choose yourself.
You can select steering, suspension, shock absorbers, and AWD.
Each one you can make not even soft or hard, but adjust them somewhere in the middle range.
In that way, you could make a 0-100 acceleration and choose a soft suspension and
sensitive steering and locked AWD coupling.
For the race track, accordingly, I may select other settings and so on.
These blank switches in the interior are annoying me right from the beginning.
To my mind when I get a car of high class, it's better to make it without any blank switches.
It was implemented in vehicles of a lower cost. But for some reason, it wasn't done here.
You could buy similar wheels in both concerns, and none of them will have blank switches.
I am glad that this car is authentic.
In this Lambo, you won't see any parts from Audi, from Volkswagen, from Skoda, from Porsche.
This is Lambo as it is. It has unique components. Everything here is something new and unique.
This is a really high-quality product developed for you,
and you just feel the unreal pleasure while you're driving a really unique car.
That's awesome. These seats, coloring, all the stuff, crazy front console.
It is clear that displays are a bit similar to Porsche Cayenne, but still, all screens look pretty identical to each other.
That's not the problem.
And most importantly is the fact that I will not tell you, but still, I'll try to explain it in 5 seconds.
If you are driving this car in the standard mode, it's called STRADA,
and it means comfort daily driving, it's 100% Porsche Cayenne.
The difference is that our "Cayenne" is rolling on 22' wheels and that leaves a mark.
If any typical Cayenne would have 20' wheels, here're 22'
because these large carbon-ceramic brakes won’t fit 20’ wheels.
That’s why there’s 22'. It's not showing off, it's a real technological need.
And now if I close my eyes, I feel like I'm at the steer of Cayenne.
But then I’m coming out of the tunnel, my eyes are open again, and I see Lamborghini!
And it’s really great! It’s awesome!
I was so pissed off with Huracan because it’s antsy, small, inconvenient and so on.
Yes, maybe this car has lost the whole feature of those Lamborghini cars.
They were uncompromising, wild, hardcore, ferocious, destroying everything that comes in their way.
They were always disheveled, it was impossible to ride a Lamborghini quietly.
The only thing that made me glad is mode availability: you pull two shift paddles, and you turn the neutral gear.
Good, but there's no exhaust shooting because we're rolling in a standard mode.
Good, let's turn CORSA mode on, then we turn neutral,
and what happens with the sound? It comes from the front speakers!
Oh, that’s reverse… I can’t turn the reverse on while driving, well, it passed the test.
The engine sound goes out from the speakers. It’s in front, guys!
I can hear it from the back and exhaust shooting too, it’s okay, but still, it's imitated.
It's in front, for real. So it will be easier to turn STRADA mode one and calm down.
And most importantly, unlike all Lamborghinis, there is an "off-road" mode.
Do you imagine? Off-road! It means that in this car, the air suspension can lift the body up!
And unlike Huracan, it really works.
I don’t have any claims about air suspension travel.
We may come off the road and try some relief!
Well. Before trying off-road, we have to reach it. What can help us?
Firstly, switch the drive selector to "off-road," but that's okay.
We should try some hardcore. We begin with driving it in Standard mode on the bad road surface.
That's what I feel whenever I try to get home in my village. Will Lambo fit me?
So… I’d never try to go there on any Lambo – neither Aventador nor Huracan.
I’d never thought about going there on them. I’m keeping 20 km/h of speed, oops, some holes…
Well, my brains are not crushed. It’s important to understand that we are on 22’ wheels.
The Skoda Oktavia is going in front of us. We need to catch it up.
Of course, we are going without any trouble, that's cool! Wonderful!
I doubt if this one could do more. I doubt if it can do something in the snow.
I don't know if it's able to overtake some intense relief, is there a full diff lock.
But! If we are going on a dirt road, my voice is not shaking at all.
The vehicle in front of us is really jumping on this road. It won't speed up more.
But we just keep the steer straight. No need to avoid any holes. Approved! Go further.
So! We're in serious trouble! Our Lambo just has met a real, harsh off-road.
We're probably dead.
There’s a problem because we have to lift an air suspension up.
It’s really lifting. By the way, its travel isn’t as short as it could be.
We also have rollover sensors, both longitudinal and transversal too.
Will diff locks work or not? I don’t know. Turn the first gear on.
It immediately leads to turning the second gear and here we go.
In fact, it’s not so convenient because I don’t see how the wheel is going on even if I lean out like that.
To be short, I should do it like that and push the gas with my tiptoe.
I can’t touch a pedal in that way.
Oh my god!
Quiet, quiet!
Will the bumper meet the concrete slab or not?
What’s up here?
It’s fine, it’s okay!
Is it? Wait for it! It’s dangerous!

Wait, wait! Easy!
Stop it! Where to steer?
Left or right??? Left??? The rim should crash right into stone! I feel it!

Come on, come on!
It’s too tough! Wait, the diagonal. It’s going to hang above the ground!
Oh shit, rocker panels passed it.
I think that was too tough! Easy, easy…
Oh goodness!
We did it?

Yes!
We did it!
Yes! That's what the pure off-road is! That's the power.
Lamborghini can be all-terrain! Awesome! Wait a second. The exhaust pipe, where is it?
Here it is. We've just proved that this car can withstand off-road of any level!
Oh God, how beautiful you are, my dear!
But still, our "off-road" didn't go deeper than dirtying our tires
because we have a spare parts specialist – Evgeniy from VAG.center, you know him well.
He estimated the cost of these giant carbon-ceramic brake discs to $4000 as a minimum for each one.
They have an exciting feature – if any small stone is ricocheted
and gets between the disc and the pad, there's a big chance to crack them.
They are unstable to mechanical stress.
And when we were dashing through the dirty stony road, it was stopped in time by his screams:
“Bro! This shit may cost you $15k at the purchase price!”
These are the biggest carbon-ceramic brakes that had ever been installed on stock cars.
Nothing else would fit there, neither ones are taken from Audi RS7 or something else,
and you won't find anything at the purchase price. It is their own brand.
This is a vast and effective engineering solution which costs enormous money.
So… Even if this car can do some off-road work,
we have no sense to continue our experiments because it’s just too expensive.
There’s also a cargo area, I don’t know how it happened.
It would seem, why Lambo needs that? But apparently, there's a need in it, because we already have back seats,
rear doors, offroad mode, so this car in a whole pretends to be an everyday routine car.
There are two features in it. Firstly, it has 600 liters of capacity, so it’s kind of a big cargo area.
Three features, then, to be exact. Secondly, We have a thing here in which you could find a
hidden warning triangle with a logo of Volkswagen-Audi… Well, a sort of coincidence.
And here is a donut spare tire under the floor of cargo area, in which we see a standard place,
where another one warning triangle with Volkswagen-Audi logo could be attached.
I think they've put two of them into just if one won't be enough.
You could be furnished with triangles and continue your performance.
After this, the vehicle pretends to be universal, so there is a button that will help you with
loading when you need to make the cargo area lower from the back.
It can be lowered if you have to load your potato here.
And there is a plastic blank switch what should be wrong,
but it's not so bad because it's obviously designed here to put a button for extending electric tow bar!
I was searching on the Internet, and I obviously can mount a towbar here,
and I may have Lambo with a towbar to carry my shit on an old rusty shitty trailer…
Perfect! Just perfect!
But, as you can understand, this Lambo wasn't made as an off-road vehicle.
In fact, lifting of the air suspension is actually a compromise.
They’ve made it for people who were angry about the Huracan,
this SUV was created to feel comfortable in everyday life with this car.
It was made to ignore any speed bumps and be okay with that.
But, all in all, this is Lambo. Its main destiny is a highway.
So everything here is made for the highway. No problem with that.
It starts to speed up madly.
It’s unreal to go nice and easy in it.
These monstrous and fucking great brakes are doing 200% of their job!
Please… Yes.
Super-duper! And the rev limiter is working in manual mode too.
That's cosmic. Holy shit, we've on that speed…. My ears are totally covered.
We've flown into the viaduct so fast that the difference in height made my ears pop.
This is cosmic, it's motherfucking cosmic!
That's incredibly fast. It's probably not as comfortable as others SUVs, but it's fast.
You should always choose – speed or comfort. You always could do a pum-pum – and it’s gone.
We’re going in silence.
All sounds are stopped. We need to press a gas pedal to accelerate.
That’s interesting, really interesting.
Okay, how fast will it switch the modes?
At once! Immediately! Just instantly! A split second! No need to do anything!
Come on, bro, no need to go to the left lane.
Oh god, it’s so cosmic.
As a result...
it turned on a normal mode at once.
Yes, there’s no usual buttons on the steering wheel.
When you are going in STRADA mode you can press the button, and that's all, it's like a hyperdrive going on.
Its job of these shift paddles and how quick they work!
There's no such a button, but I really have no claims about it.
I like it so much on the highway. At the same time, does it have back seat? - Yes!
Does this seat have cup holders? – Yes! Will my children be able to seat here? – Yes!
Am I able to do all kinds of terrible things in traffic without them? – Yes!
And we came to the conclusion that in my humble estimation this is the ideal Lamborghini.
It's because I'm glad not about being able to rush, but about living everyday life with it.
First of all, I estimate this car for whether I will be able to make 150-200 km mileage on it, doing my business.
For example, even to make one of my videos, put some skis;
carry home baseboards for repair and load more cement in the cargo area – this motherfucking Lambo can do it!
Holy crap! This is the most unusual Lambo that I’ve met on Earth, and at the same time, it keeps Lambo character.
It's because….
Because it's bloody fast! Oh gosh. You have to be ready for the level of speeding up.
It is swift, and it's a great fight against lateral overloads, excellent.
I can maneuver. Oh shit, how it's reacting to the steering!
In the previous video, I was talking that I can twitch the steering wheel like that.
For that one, it's way too dangerous.
Fourteenth! (VAZ 2114, a.k.a. 14). Fourteenth. It’s time to compete with “14”!
People who drive “14" are the most dangerous people on Earth.
Oh, God. Oh my. I love it so much.
Yep, it's not perfect at all. There's no car ionization. I can’t choose the scent of a heater, for example.
There’s no… There's plenty of blank switches. Sorry.
But it doesn’t really matter if you want to combine the car for every day with this!
I don’t know what else could be as cool as this one, especially with such a wild appearance.
Even if we may say that this is an Ultra-Cayenne;
in fact, I am a supporter of the fact that it is ultra-Cayenne, because the platform leaves the trace,
and anyway, you understand that it’s not Lamborghini’s chassis,
it’s Volkswagen’s or Audi’s or Porsche’s one and so on…
More than that, if you tried driving these cars, you may close your eyes now and clearly see what car you are driving.
But! This is maximum Cayenne, an Ultra-Cayenne. It has Lambo’s exterior.
Everyone wants it because it works everywhere and whenever!
Is it started or stopped, is it being driven or standing still, whatever it does – it’s Lamborghini.
Any person standing in front of Cayenne and Lambo will always choose Lambo.
And at the same time, it's exclusive. It has no Cayenne parts.
At least the ones you can see with your eyes.
And I don't like Lamborghini at all!
I was going to do a review, and I wanted to destroy this car, because what the fuck?
20 million and cruise control is NOT adaptive???
If I turn cruise control on and leave it like that, we will smash right into the Solaris in front of us, but why do we need such problems?
We don’t have a head-up display there too, come on, for that price, what???
But okay, these options can be bought.
These options could be here. We just need to pay some extra money.
Why not, we did find $300k; why not give them a couple more?
And, secondly, there are still carbon-ceramic brakes, and still, this is Lambo.
I can speak about it on the run so much but in fact…
That's all. It's swift. There's so much traction that you feel it even on the steering wheel.
It's incredible. It's God damn fast. That’s all I can say about this car. Just epic.
The steering is a masterpiece. It's controlled so well by the steering wheel. How it's good at cornering!
It's so amazing! Damn, I really want to test it on the race track.
But this is prohibited by the rental rules. When we got 911,
we actually agreed on the test on a race track in a rental agreement, but we didn’t do it with Lambo.
But I just want to go to the race track so much.
The SUV on the race track is the most thankless shit in this life. This is insane.
But this time, I admit in advance that it will be an exception.
Now let's turn a standard mode. My God that feels really good.
It's so nice!
Well, gentlemen, here we got a car which wasn’t unremarkable for me at the beginning.
I was thinking: what is SUV Lamborghini?
At least it's a crossover, and it's obviously not fast, not steered well, it's something heavy.
It has almost 2200 kg of weight and almost the same power that my Range Rover has.
Well, what I haven't seen there? It turned out that the same power can be performed very differently.
And there is plenty of cars with 650 horsepowers inside or even more,
but for today there's no faster crossover that that one.
It happened so that such engineering inspired Lamborghini’s philosophy into Cayenne’s body.
I should name it word by word.  First Lambor[d3i]ni, then Lambor[gi]ni.
I will be felt up with a shit right to my ears.
Because it's not already an old true Lamborghini and still it's not a Porsche Cayenne. It's something between.
On the other side, if you want to have this tough exterior and if you want to be loved by everyone, you should have it.
I understand people who buy it, actually, and I already understand people who take it in a rental.
Paying crazy money for the rent of this car seems to be nonsense.
But in fact, you would never feel anything like this nowadays.
I could even mount a towbar! A towbar, for goodness sake!
I can use it to carry a pile of manure from my granny to my lovely garden.

It's not so much about "how I like it," but about how much my idea of Urus was turned around.
